CreditLine: Museum purchase with funds provided by the W. Alton Jones Foundation Acquisition Fund, 1996
Description: This triptych (three-paneled icon) is distinguished by its somber colors, linear patterns, and sense of quiet melancholy. The combination of white and black bands on the wings, which is rare in Ethiopian art, creates a bold pattern that serves as a background for Christ and the saints. The victorious, resurrected Christ, seen at the upper right, holds in his hand a processional cross.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: Angels of Light: Ethiopian Art from the Walters Art Museum
Exhibitions.Textblock: Angels of Light: Ethiopian Art from the Walters Art Museum. Birmingham Museum of Art, Birmingham; Smith College Museum of Art, Northampton; Museum of Biblical Art, New York. 2006-2007.
Ethiopian Art at The Walters. The Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore. 1996.

Title: Triptych with Mary and Her Son, Archangels, Scenes from Life of Christ and Saints
